runs.task: Add unit tests for Norwegian streaming mapper
runs.details: Added 25 tests covering getNorwegianStreaming(), applyNorwegianStreaming(), and norwegianStreamingMap data structure. Tests verify league matching (case-insensitive, partial), sport aliases (formula1→f1), default fallbacks, null/empty inputs, and event mutation.

runs.task: Add curated config schedule verification script
runs.details: Created scripts/verify-schedules.js that cross-references curated config event dates against ESPN scoreboard data, validates date ranges, detects mismatches, and auto-corrects high-confidence time drift. Integrates into health-report.json. 37 unit tests.

runs.task: Add unit tests for api-client.js
runs.details: 22 tests covering constructor defaults/custom options, buildURL templating, cache hit/stale fallback, JSON parse errors, HTTP 4xx/5xx handling, retry logic, network error retries, timeout, and fetchWithDates.

runs.task: Add unit tests for base-fetcher.js
runs.details: 33 tests covering constructor, fetch pipeline, fetchFromAPIs source iteration/error accumulation, applyFilters (timeRange, maxEvents), normalizeEvents, formatResponse, groupEventsByTournament, hasNorwegianInterest, and abstract methods.

runs.task: Add aria-expanded to featured section expand buttons
runs.details: Added aria-expanded=false to .feat-expand buttons in renderSection() and toggle in click handler, matching the band toggle pattern from PR #26.

runs.task: Improve sport iteration efficiency in renderBand()
runs.details: Refactored renderBand() to iterate only sport groups with events using index map for SPORT_CONFIG ordering, instead of iterating all 7 sports. Added fallback for unknown sport IDs.

runs.task: Add thumbs-up/down feedback to watch-plan items
runs.details: Added feedback controls to watch-plan picks in dashboard.js. Feedback stored in localStorage via new PreferencesManager methods. CSS styling, toggle behavior, 5 new tests. Phase 1 Step 2 of vision roadmap.

runs.task: Add trend tracking to autonomy scorecard
runs.details: Added trackTrend() and detectRegressions() to autonomy-scorecard.js. Tracks score over time in autonomy-trend.json (max 30 entries). Wired into pipeline-health.js with regression warnings. 7 new tests.

runs.task: Add unit tests for fotball-no.js
runs.details: 19 tests covering extractIcsField, parseIcsDateTime (date-only, CET, CEST timezone conversion), and parseIcsForLynMatches (Lyn extraction, TZID handling, missing location, edge cases). Exported 3 internal parsing helpers for testability.
runs.lesson: Exporting private functions for testing is a clean pattern — minimal change, big test coverage gain.

runs.task: Add descriptive alt text to brief-line images
runs.details: Added team/player name as alt text on brief-line logo and headshot images in dashboard.js for screen reader accessibility.
runs.lesson: Simple a11y fixes are quick wins — variable already in scope, just needs wiring into alt attribute.

runs.task: Remove dead CSS rules from index.html
runs.details: Removed .editorial-header, .section-divider, .more-toggle, .more-content CSS rules (~30 lines) — no JS code generates elements with these classes.
runs.lesson: Verify CSS class usage via grep before removal. .band-results looked dead but was actually dynamically generated.

runs.task: Add descriptive alt text to result row images
runs.details: Added team names to football result logos and player names to golf result headshots as alt text. Completes all empty alt='' fixes in dashboard.js.
runs.lesson: Batch similar a11y fixes across the same file for efficiency.

runs.task: Add a11y labels to favorites, streaming, watch-plan, and brief logos
runs.details: Added aria-label to favorite buttons (add/remove state), streaming badge links (Watch on {platform}), watch-plan picks (role=button, tabindex=0, keydown handler), and descriptive alt text to brief-line logos. Batched 4 small a11y tasks into one PR.
runs.lesson: Batching multiple small a11y fixes in the same file into one PR is very efficient.

runs.task: Add validation and helper tests for fetch-results.js
runs.details: Exported formatDate, isFavoriteTeam, isFavoritePlayer for testability. Added 31 new tests covering validation functions and helper utilities.
runs.lesson: Check existing test files before creating new ones — the roadmap said no test file existed but it did. Added tests for untested functions instead.

runs.task: Add unit tests for fetch-rss.js
runs.details: Test file already exists with 17 tests covering parseRssItems, isNorwegianRelevant, filterRecent, buildRssContext, and schema. Roadmap was inaccurate.
runs.lesson: Always verify task assumptions (like 'no test file exists') before starting work.

runs.task: Hide F1 standings when all drivers have zero points
runs.details: Added guard in renderF1Standings() to skip rendering when all driver points are zero. Prevents misleading empty standings display during pre-season or with stale API data.
runs.lesson: Data quality guards in the UI layer are quick wins — prevent misleading displays without touching the data pipeline.

runs.task: Update roadmap: mark 7 already-implemented tasks as DONE
runs.details: Tasks #3 (tennis results), #4 (F1 results), #7 (golf fallback), #10 (pipeline-health tests), #11 (sync-configs tests), #12 (test fix), and #23 (intervention tracking) were all already implemented but roadmap was stale.
runs.lesson: Always verify task completion before starting work — many tasks were already done by previous runs but roadmap wasn't updated.
runs.meta_insight: Roadmap staleness is a recurring issue. Each completed task should update the roadmap atomically within its own PR.

runs.task: Add cross-loop dependency detection (Detector 7)
runs.details: Added analyzeCrossLoopDependencies() to analyze-patterns.js. Detects when enrichment or results drops correlate with editorial drops. 6 new tests. Wired into orchestrator and pattern-report.json.
runs.lesson: Pattern detection tasks are straightforward when the data structure and existing detectors provide clear examples to follow.
runs.meta_insight: The analyze-patterns.js detector pattern is highly composable — adding new detectors takes minimal effort because the structure is consistent.

runs.task: Add rolling quality trend averages to snapshots
runs.details: Added computeRollingAverages() to ai-quality-gates.js. Each quality-history snapshot now includes rollingAverage with 7-entry moving averages for key metrics. Wired into generate-featured.js. 4 new tests.
runs.lesson: Quality infrastructure tasks that extend existing data structures are fast and low-risk. The biggest time cost is understanding the data flow.
runs.meta_insight: Rolling averages enable the quality decline detector to catch gradual degradation — this makes Detector 2 more sensitive to slow trends.

runs.task: Fix recurring sport_zero_events health warnings
runs.details: Demoted sport_zero_events from warning to info when data file is fresh. Only warns when data is also stale (>6h). Stops 88+ recurring false alarms for tennis/esports that were polluting pattern-report.json.
runs.lesson: Health warning severity should reflect the actual problem state, not just the existence of a condition. Fresh data with no events is expected, not a warning.
runs.meta_insight: Recurring false alarms desensitize the system to real issues. Fixing severity classification has multiplicative value — all downstream detectors benefit.

runs.task: Add collapsible inline Premier League mini-table
runs.details: Added renderInlinePLTable() to dashboard.js. Shows top 5 PL teams + favorite teams, collapsed by default, with position gaps and favorite highlighting. Added inline-standings CSS.
runs.lesson: UI features that reuse existing patterns (exp-mini-table, band toggle) are quick to implement. The research phase was the biggest time cost.
runs.meta_insight: The dashboard has clear extension points: band system for sections, exp-mini-table for data display, preferences for personalization. New widgets slot in easily.

runs.task: Add thumbs-up/down feedback on watch-plan picks
runs.details: Added watch-plan feedback controls: thumbs-up/down buttons on each pick, stored in localStorage via PreferencesManager. Toggle behavior, proper event propagation handling. CSS styling consistent with existing design.
runs.lesson: UI feedback features that integrate with existing storage patterns (PreferencesManager) are quick to implement. The main complexity is proper event handling (stopPropagation for buttons inside clickable containers).
runs.meta_insight: Watch-plan feedback is the prerequisite for closing the personalization loop. Next step: export this feedback to the pipeline so it influences future watch-plan scoring.

runs.task: Evolve favorite teams/players from engagement data
runs.details: Extended evolve-preferences.js to sync favorite teams/players from client-side exports (GitHub Issues + engagement-data.json) into user-context.json. Case-insensitive deduplication. 14 new tests.
runs.lesson: Extending an existing pipeline script with a new data path is straightforward when the existing structure is clean. The main work is parsing the data format and adding deduplication.
runs.meta_insight: Personalization now covers both sport-level weights AND individual teams/players. The pipeline can learn new favorites from the client-side without manual config changes.

runs.task: Add generate-insights pipeline step
runs.details: Created scripts/generate-insights.js with football streaks, standings gaps, golf leaderboard, F1 championship, and high-scoring match analysis. Dashboard renders top 5 insights as accent cards. Added to pipeline-manifest.json generate phase. 22 tests.
runs.lesson: Pure data analysis scripts (no LLM) are fast to build and test. The main complexity was sorting priority correctly (0 || 2 = 2 due to falsy zero — use ?? instead of ||).
runs.meta_insight: First new pipeline step added by the autopilot via pipeline-manifest.json editing. This proves the manifest pattern works for self-expanding capabilities.

runs.task: Add inline golf leaderboard and F1 standings widgets
runs.details: Added collapsible inline widgets for golf (top 5 + Norwegian players) and F1 (top 5 drivers, hidden when pre-season) following the existing PL mini-table pattern.
runs.lesson: Following an established UI pattern (PL mini-table) makes new widgets trivial. Direct-to-main is appropriate for small, low-risk UI additions.
runs.meta_insight: All three standings sources (PL, golf, F1) now have inline widgets. This closes the data-to-UI gap for standings.

runs.task: Add event-fingerprint-based preview caching
runs.details: Preview briefings now use MD5 event fingerprints for change detection instead of fixed 24h timer. Only regenerates when events for the preview date actually change. Falls back to time-based staleness for legacy files. 6 tests.
runs.lesson: Caching improvements that reduce unnecessary AI calls are high-leverage. The fingerprint approach is simple and deterministic.
runs.meta_insight: Event fingerprinting can be extended to other cached content (e.g., enrichment could skip re-processing unchanged events).

runs.task: Close watch-plan feedback loop in scoring
runs.details: Added computeFeedbackAdjustments() to watch-plan.js — parses sport from pick IDs, computes per-sport scoring adjustments (-10 to +10). generate-featured.js reads engagement-data.json and passes adjustments. 8 new tests.
runs.lesson: Watch feedback data was already being collected and stored — the gap was only in the scoring function consuming it. Small change, large personalization impact.
runs.meta_insight: The watch-plan personalization loop is now fully closed: collect → store → aggregate → score. This is the first end-to-end feedback loop for content personalization.

runs.task: Add empty-sport explanatory text in dashboard
runs.details: Added renderEmptySportNotes() showing 'No upcoming X events' for followed sports with zero events. CSS styled with muted text and left border.
runs.lesson: Simple UI affordances that explain missing data reduce user confusion. The implementation was straightforward since SPORT_CONFIG already had all needed metadata.
runs.meta_insight: Empty states are important UX — the dashboard now communicates absence of data instead of silently hiding sports.

runs.task: Add tennis ATP/WTA rankings to standings pipeline
runs.details: Added fetchTennisRankings() for ATP/WTA (top 20 per tour). buildStandingsContext() includes ATP top 10 in editorial prompts. 6 new tests.
runs.lesson: ESPN tennis standings API follows the exact same structure as F1 — the pattern was instantly reusable. Chaining data+UI tasks in same run maximizes value.
runs.meta_insight: Tennis now has rankings data flowing through the pipeline. This enables inline widget (done) and richer editorial context. The data-to-capability pipeline is proven: fetch → store → context → render.

runs.task: Add inline ATP tennis rankings widget
runs.details: Collapsible ATP top 5 + Casper Ruud widget following PL/golf/F1 inline standings pattern. Fourth inline widget added to dashboard.
runs.lesson: Following established UI patterns (inline standings widget) makes new data sources trivially renderable. Data→UI latency was near-zero by doing both in the same run.
runs.meta_insight: All four standings sources (PL, golf, F1, tennis) now have inline widgets. The inline standings pattern is fully mature and extensible.
